channel.title: linux on GrooveStomp
channel.description: Recent content in linux on GrooveStomp

item.title: VPS Learning
item.description: Today we learn how little I know about system administration. I host most of my own “cloud” services on a VPS I rent from SSDNodes. Recently I purchased an upgraded KVM node for reasons of which I’ll get into later. Anyway, I ran into a hiccup while trying to start migrating from my older VPS. └─ curl 142.44.184.204 curl: (56) Recv failure: Connection reset by peer Hmm. NOTE: First of all, I know the machine is reachable because I can SSH into it.

item.title: Linuxing
item.description: Have you ever heard of suckless1? I think I stumbled onto suckless sometime while reading K. Mandla2, though there’s a reasonable chance it might have happened before then. suckless immediately resonated with me because of their philosophy3. Their software also looks good, very accurately reflecting the idea of minimalism4; often requiring you to rethink how you typically interact with software to do what you want to do. Sometimes this process of re-evaluation is fruitful, sometimes maybe less so, but it’s always interesting to experience.

item.title: I like KDE
item.description: So, it turns out I like KDE. I use Ubuntu a lot. It’s installed on all of my computers and it’s the server OS I’ve used at work for the past five or so years. Typically I stick with Unity on the desktop. There are a few reasons why I opted to change: I like to try new things, I get bored, I haven’t used KDE in a while. It’s hard to say exactly.

item.title: RFTG on Linux
item.description: Through the magic of Wine (specifically the PlayOnLinux variant) I’m now able to play RFTG on my Ubuntu machine from System 76. Oh happy day! :-)
